headline.main: 'I Want Kissinger to Think on Camera'; Frost Vs. Kissinger

results.snippet: This Thursday at 10 P.M. on NBC, David Frost will interview Henry Kissinger about the former Secretary of State's stewardship of foreign  policy during the years of the first Nixon Administration. The hour-long interview is tied to the publication...
results.lead_paragraph: This Thursday at 10 P.M. on NBC, David Frost will interview Henry Kissinger about the former Secretary of State's stewardship of foreign policy during the years of the first Nixon Administration. The hour-long interview is tied to the publication later this month of the Kissinger memoirs.

results.abstract: Cadet honor committee, in unsusual move, sends letter to Army Secretary Clifford L Alexander, asking why he reversed his approval of dismissal of Cadet Moses G Davis for fraternizing with female cadet in December '78; request seen underlining charge expressed in recent open meetings at Academy that Washington bowed to political and personal pressures in interfering with cadet-run honor system; case, investigation and events leading to and following Davis dismissal and acquittal reviewed; Davis portrait (L)

headline.main: Cadets Resist Honor Case Reversal; Denial on Fraternizing

results.snippet: WEST POINT, N.Y., Oct. 11--It was just before the Christmas recess last year, and Cadet Moses G. Davis, a sophomore at the United States Military Academy, was chatting with a plebe, or freshman, woman in their barracks. She was sitting in her room;...

byline.original: By JAMES FERON Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WEST POINT, N.Y., Oct. 11--It was just before the Christmas recess last year, and Cadet Moses G. Davis, a sophomore at the United States Military Academy, was chatting with a plebe, or freshman, woman in their barracks. She was sitting in her room; he was standing in the doorway.

results.snippet: They will arrive by the thousands from 45 states and 90 foreign countries, lured by the prospect of trying to complete 26 miles and 385 yards in the New York City Marathon.

results.snippet: In commemoration of the 10th anniversary of man's landing on the moon, Meteor Crater--a training site for moon-walking astronauts near Flagstaff, Ariz.,-- has opened the Astronaut Hall of Fame.
results.lead_paragraph: In commemoration of the 10th anniversary of man's landing on the moon, Meteor Crater--a training site for moon-walking astronauts near Flagstaff, Ariz.,-- has opened the Astronaut Hall of Fame.
